Enables the user to: Follow reduced number of checks on imports if they are an approved Trusted Trader
Policy outcome: Enables the Trusted Trader to use the Health Certificate at point of origin and removes the need for a Health Certificate to be replicated at transfer hubs and stay compliant to BTOM policy

User facing name: Apply for Authorised Economic Operator status
Internal name: Apply for Authorised Economic Operator status
User groups: Importers; Exporters; Customs Agents; Carriers; Port Operators
Enables the user to: Carry out their role in the movement of goods safely and legally
Policy outcome: Demonstrates a business's role in the international supply chain is secure and has customs control procedures that meet Authorised Economic Operator standards and criteria

Enables the user to: Book a specific inspection time for their animals so they can then transport and logistics
Policy outcome: Meets BTOM policy for moving high risk goods into GB

User facing name: Book transport for movement of goods (GMR)

Policy outcome: Provides HMRC visibility of the goods, which vehicle it is on and where it is in advance and during the goods movement

Internal name:
Digital Guidance for Industry (DGFI)
CHED Implementation
Enables the user to: Enables the user creating the notification in IPAFFS to enter the names of up to 5 individuals involved in the movement who may need to receive messages about the consignment as it moves (e.g.. driver, haulier etc)
Policy outcome: A dynamic risk categoisation which supports the BTOM model
Outputs: BTOM Risk Category of your goods

User facing name: Checks away from the Border Module
Internal name: Checks away from the Border Module
Enables the user to: Avoid BCPs and have SPS checks done at their place of business
Policy outcome: Allows SPS checks to be done at importers place of business, not in BCP.  (Medium Risk Products only)

?
Policy outcome: Ensures required pre-notification documentation directly feeds into IPAFFS

Enables the user to: Trade goods safely and legally
Policy outcome: Ensure traders (and anyone involved in the movement of goods) is operating safely and legally

Internal name: Goods Vehicle Movement System (GVMS) - Messaging Services
Enables the user to: Register vehicles and consignments in advance of goods moving
Policy outcome: Ensures that traders, hauliers and carriers are registered with HMRC so they can safely and legally move goods into GB

Internal name: Goods Vehicle Movement System (GVMS) - Messaging Services
Enables the user to: Communication to users of GVMS (Drivers, hauliters, importers etc)
Policy outcome: Sends message to driver (while in transit) if goods need to be checked at Border

User facing name: Import of products, animals, food and feed system
Enables the user to: Notify enforcement authorities about imports to Great Britain.
Policy outcome: All POAO and PSP goods coming into the UK are registered centrally
Inputs: Signed EHC, IPAFFS  Commodity Code & Risk Rating
Outputs: There are four types of CHEDs, depending on the goods for which it is issued: CHED A, CHED P, CHED PP, CHED D.

Enables the user to: Move through to appropriate border check according to their risk level (based on a matching of IPAFFS and CDS data)
Policy outcome: Performs a check to see if the CHED reference number, commodity code(s) and total net weights are equivalent in both IPAFFS and CDS

Enables the user to: Allows inspectors to check all the documents submitted by the importer inadvance of the goods arriving into GB
Policy outcome: Enables PHA's to perform documentary checks on 100% of the high and medium risk consignments, but not for the low risk consignments.?

Enables the user to: Nominated parties receive notifications about their movement of goods via IPAFFS
Policy outcome: Sends message to driver (while in transit) if goods need to be checked at Border

Enables the user to: Allows inspectors to record the decision of the Border Control Post inspection
Policy outcome: Enables BCP inspectors to record the steps they take and the decisions they make regarding an import

Enables the user to: Ensures importers follow the correct processes and requirements to import their goods safely and accurately based on its BTOM risk categorisation
Policy outcome: Key part of BTOM. Based on all information submitted, including the risk category determined by the rules engine, the risk engine calculates the inspection regime the shipment should be subject to based on risk category and commodity type.

Enables the user to: Ensures importers follow the correct processes and requirements to import their goods safely and accurately based on its BTOM risk categorisation
Policy outcome: Key part of BTOM. This module determines whether a check should be conducted or not based on the percentage of consignments checked so far to make sure the percentage of checks made is kept within bounds.

Enables the user to: Ensures importers follow the correct processes and requirements to import their goods safely and accurately based on its BTOM risk categorisation
Policy outcome: Key part of BTOM. Based on commodity code and country of origin, rules engine classifies all goods as either a High, Medium or Low risk category. This classification specifies the certification needed to move goods into GB

Enables the user to: Pay the Common User Charge so they can move a consignment of goods through the Port of Dover and Eurotunnel
Policy outcome: Covering the costs of the new border checks. The CUC applies to commercial movements of animal products, plants and plant products through the Port of Dover and Eurotunnel
Links: Common user charge: rates and eligibility - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk)

Enables the user to: Provide more detail about the goods movement journey resulting in a reduced number of risk based checks needed at border
Policy outcome: Trusted traders provide additional data about the import journey which would be valuable and provide greater reassurance (e.g. smart seals, temperature controls etc) to support future benefit/easier movement.

User facing name: Risk Based Checks at the Border
Internal name: Risk Based Checks at the Border
User groups: Drivers; Importers, Border Control Post Inspectors
Enables the user to: Ensures the user and their goods are following the correct proceedures for checks at the border based on their BTOM risk rating
Policy outcome:
Ensures the correct % of goods are checked based on their risk level:
High risk = 100% being inspected
Medium risk = between 1 -30% being inspected
Low risk will not be inspected unless intelligence has deemed the need for an inspection.?

Service line: Moving goods into Great Britain;Moving goods out of Great Britain
Policy outcome:
The Defra Trade Platform is a key component of the EU & Trade Delivery Portfolio, it provides an API based Electronic Data Interchange capability for UK Plc facilitating Trade, Business Processes and Security, providing 3rd Parties with the ability to electronically exchange data with Defra. 
The Trade Platform is an underpinning technical service and common platform for the EU Trade and Delivery portfolio and is consumed by end user and business facing LOB applications, including Plant Exports and IPAFFS.
